Name.label: Disease associated with a genetic susceptibility or tested for a biomarker
Miscellaneous movement disorder due to neurodegenerative disease

TextSection.Contents: A rare, acquired human prion disease characterized by rapidly progressive neurodegeneration, cerebellar symptoms (especially ataxia, but also tremor, dysarthria, and nystagmus) being the most prominent clinical feature, following an asymptomatic incubation period of up to several decades and a non-specific prodromal phase with headaches and arthralgia. Other neurological signs occurring in the course of the disease involve also the brain stem, mid-brain, hypothalamus, and cerebral cortex. Emotional changes include inappropriate euphoria and compulsive laughter, or depression and apprehension. The disease is invariably fatal within approximately one year.

Name.label: BTNT (broader term maps to a narrower term)
